projectPurpose: To provide an open-source, high-performance build cache and remote execution server that accelerates the build and test processes of compatible build systems like Bazel, Pants, and Buck2 by leveraging remote infrastructure.
mainFeatures: Compatible with Bazel, Pants, Buck2, Reclient, and other RBE-compatible build systems

alternatives.name: bazel-remote
mainFeatures: Supports disk, S3, GCS, and Azure backends

alternatives.name: Buildfarm
mainFeatures: Compatible with Bazel, Buck2, Pants, etc.

marketPositioning: NativeLink is positioned as a high-performance, open-source implementation of the Bazel Remote Execution API. It competes with other open-source alternatives like Buildbarn and Buildfarm by emphasizing performance and Rust-based implementation. Compared to commercial services such as BuildBuddy and EngFlow, NativeLink offers the control and transparency of open source, appealing to organizations preferring self-hosted solutions. Its focus on speed and support for specialized hardware caters to users with demanding build workloads and specific infrastructure needs within the RBE-compatible build system ecosystem.
